post_text: To all parents/guardians of LMHS students: This is to clarify our attendance expectations in light of COVID-19. All attendance policies outlined in the Parent -Student Handbook still apply. However, if your student is having a medical issue and cannot come to school on a given day, but does feel well enough to participate remotely, you may call the Academic Office prior to 8:00 a.m. for pre-approval of a remote day. In order for the student to be counted as present, there MUST be preapproval for medical reasons AND the student must participate fully in ALL scheduled classes for the day through the remote learning format. Please also send a parent excuse when your student returns and note that he/she participated remotely on that day. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we move through uncharted waters!

March 13: the day none of us will ever forget. At 3:20, we walked into the high school cafeteria for a brief meeting that would change our lives and the fate of our production. "The production is not being cancelled; just postponed." Ok, we thought with tears rolling down out faces.....how do we tell the kids?? Fast forward almost four months later; we did it. I don't think any of us thought we would be sitting here, reflecting on finally being able to close out our show after a whirlwind of two weeks in rehearsal. We cannot thank everyone enough for their love and support, not only pre-covid but especially now. I hope that we were able to safely bring some joy back into your hearts. From the cast, crew, Pit and production team....thank you.

Some good news from our friends at Sheetz:

Sheetz Expands Free Meal Program to All 600 Stores

Sheetz is proud to announce the expansion of the Kidz Meal Bagz program providing free food to help children and families in need as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. Meal Bagz will be available at all 600 Sheetz locations and will be available daily, while supplies last.

The Meal Bagz include a turkey sandwich, chips and a drink. Families interested in taking advantage of the free program can go to any Sheetz location and ask an employee for a meal at the register or through the drive-through.

As we expand this program, our goal is to help feed those kids who are most in need. Through our first two weeks, it has been very hard to anticipate the demand at each store, but we are remaining connected to our communities in order to help as many people as possible. However, since this is a special item assembled by our supply chain and vendor partners, we do have limited quantities.

The program will be available for the next two weeks at which time it will be reevaluated based on community need.

post_text: We're missing your kids...
shared_text:
Teresa Vasko Merckle
March 16 at 7:34 AM ¬∑

If you know a teacher, please don't ask them if they are happy to have at least 3 weeks off or tell them it must be nice to have 3 weeks off. No, we're not happy. We spend 7 hours a day, 5 days a week with our students. They become our kids. We want to see our kids. We want to go to work. We want our routine. While it looks like we are just sitting at home, we are doing anything but that. We are constantly thinking about our kids. We are wondering about the ones we know depend on the school for food and warmth. We are wondering about the ones who need our hugs each day. We are wondering about the ones who live with grandparents in the at risk group. We wonder about the ones with working parents who can't stay home and who they are with. We think about the ones who were 'just getting' something and wonder if we can pick up where we left off when (if) we return. We think about how our kids can possibly finish this year and move on next year when there is so much left to teach this year. We wonder how we are going to possibly teach from home . We just want our normal back.
